data.title: What Happened in May 1958
data.meta_description: What happened in May 1958. Browse historical events, famous birthdays and notable deaths from May 1958 or search by date, day or keyword.
data.text:
Historical Events

Ambonese rebellion bombs Ambon, conquers Morotai

May 1 Arturo Frondizi sworn in as President of Argentina

Yanks threaten to broadcast games nationwide if NL goes ahead with plans to broadcast, games into NYC

84th Kentucky Derby: Ismael Valenzuela aboard Tim Tam wins in 2:05

May 3 WINS suspends disc jockey Alan Freed for being charged with inciting a riot at a Boston concert, he quits, charges are dropped

Alberto Lleras Camargo chosen as president of Colombia

KNME TV channel 5 in Albuquerque, NM (PBS) begins broadcasting

May 5 Pulitzer Prize for Fiction awarded to James Agee for "Death in the Family"

May 5 US performs atmospheric nuclear test at Enewetak Atoll in the Marshall Islands

US Air Force Major Howard Johnson sets world aircraft altitude record in a Lockhead F-104 Starfighter at 27,810 m

Dracula Released

Classic Hammer horror film "Dracula" film starring Christopher Lee as the eponymous vampire alongside Peter Cushing, directed by Terence Fisher released

Little Rock Crisis

US President Eisenhower orders National Guard out of Central High School, Little Rock, Arkansas

Nixon Stoned in Peru

US VP Richard Nixon is shoved, stoned, booed and spat upon by protesters in Peru

Vertigo Released

"Vertigo", American film noir psychological thriller directed by Alfred Hitchcock, starring Jimmy Stewart and Kim Novak, is released

Sports History

Russian Mikhail Botvinnik recaptures world chess championship

US performs atmospheric nuclear test at Bikini Island

May 11 US performs its second atmospheric nuclear test of the day, this one at Enewetak Atoll in the Marshall Islands

"Nee Nee Na Na Na Na Nu Nu" by Dicky Doo & The Don'ts hits #40

May 12 US & Canada form North American Air Defense Command (NORAD)

May 12 US performs atmospheric nuclear test at Enewetak Atoll in the Marshall Islands

French settlers riot against French army in Algeria

May 13 Jordan & Iraq form Arab Federation

Musial 8th to 3,000

MLB player Stan Musial is 8th to get 3,000 hits

MLB San Francisco Giants teammates Willie Mays & Darryl Spencer each hit 2 HRs & a triple, and combine for 10 RBI in a 16-9 win over the Dodgers at Los Angeles

May 13 Pierre Pflimlin forms French government

Nixon Attacked in Venezuela

The motorcade carrying US Vice President Richard Nixon is attacked in Caracas, Venezuela; several of Nixon's staff are injured

May 13 The trade mark Velcro is registered

Gigi Premieres

"Gigi" based on the story by Colette, directed by Vincent Minnelli and starring Leslie Caron and Maurice Chevalier premieres in New York (Best Picture 1959)

May 15 USSR launches Sputnik III

Eli Beeding experiences 83 g deceleration on a rocket sled, New Mexico

May 16 Major Irwin, USAF, flies a Lockheed Starfight F-104 A to a record 1,404.18 MPH

83rd Preakness: Ismael Valenzuela aboard Tim Tam wins in 1:57.2

May 17 Emergency crisis proclaimed in Algeria

11th Cannes Film Festival: "The Cranes Are Flying" directed by Mikhail Kalatozov wins the Palme d'Or

Birthday Party

Premiere of Harold Pinter's play "Birthday Party" in London

May 19 Rogers and Hammerstein "South Pacific" soundtrack album goes #1 & stays #1 for 31 weeks

US performs nuclear test at Enewetak Atoll (atmospheric tests)

Indonesian paratroopers reconquer Morotai Island

May 21 US performs nuclear test at Bikini Island (atmospheric tests)

Influential modernist skyscraper the Seagram Building designed by Mies van der Rohe officially opens in Manhattan, New York

Explorer 1 ceases transmission - 1st US satellite launched into space January 1958

Event of Interest

Mao Zedong starts the "Great Leap Forward" movement in China, kills between 23 and 55 million Chinese citizens due to famine and forced labor

May 23 US schools 1st use Cliff's Notes

Bob Merrill's musical "New Girl in Town", starring Gwen Verdon and Thelma Ritter, closes at 46th St Theater, NYC, after 432 performances and 2 Tony Award wins

Battle of Interest

Cuban President Fulgencio Batista opens military offensive against Fidel Castro's armed rebellion

May 24 United Press Association and International News Service merge to form United Press International

Ceylon emergency crisis proclaimed

May 26 Union Square, San Francisco becomes state historical landmark

May 26 US performs nuclear test at Enewetak Atoll (atmospheric tests)

Ernest Green becomes the 1st African-American to graduate from Little Rock's Central High School

May 27 Maiden flight of the F-4 Phantom II

May 27 Vanguard SLV-1 launched for Earth orbit (failed)

European Cup Final, Brussels: Francisco Gento scores the winner in extra time as Real Madrid beats AC Milan, 3-2; 3rd consecutive title for Los Blancos

French History

French government of Prime Minister Pierre Pflimlin resigns; 200,000 demonstrate against Charles de Gaulle

Indianapolis 500: Jimmy Bryan wins a race best known for a massive first-lap, 15-car pileup that results in death of fan-favourite driver Pat O'Connor

May 30 Unidentified soldiers killed in WW II & Korean War buried in Arlington

May 30 US performs nuclear test at Enewetak Atoll (atmospheric tests)

57th Women's French Championships: Zsuzsi Kormoczy beats Shirley Bloomer (6-4, 1-6, 6-2)

May 31 Dick Dale invents "surf music" with "Let's Go Trippin"

May 31 French Championships Men's Tennis: Mervyn Rose wins his first and only French title; beats Luis Ayala of Chile 6-3, 6-4, 6-4

May 31 US performs nuclear test at Bikini Island (atmospheric tests)

Famous Birthdays

Dean Garcia, British session and touring guitarist and bass player (Curve, 1990-2005; Eurythmics, 1983-85), born in London, England

May 3 Kevin Kilner, American actor (Earth:Final Conflict), born in Baltimore, Maryland

May 3 Sandi Toksvig, Danish-British comedian and radio presenter (The Great British Baking Show), born in Copenhagen, Denmark

Keith Haring

American graffiti artist (Vanity Fair, Paris Review) and social activist, born in Reading, Pennsylvania

Ron Arad, Israeli Air Force weapon systems officer (WSO) who is officially classified as missing in action since October 1986, born in Hod HaSharon, Israel

(María) "Lolita" Flores, Spanish-Gypsy singer ("Sarandonga"). and actress, born in Madrid, Spain

Louis Orr, American college basketball coach (Bowling Green State University 2007–14, Seton Hall 2001-06), born in Cincinnati, Ohio (d. 2022)

Lovie Smith, American football coach (NFL Coach of the Year 2005 Chicago Bears; TB Buccaneers, Houston Texans; Uni of Illinois), born in Gladewater, Texas

Esko Rechardt, Finnish yachtsman (Olympic gold 1980)

Ellen Ochoa, PhD/Astronaut (STS 56, 66), born in Los Angeles, California

May 10 Rick Santorum, American politician (Rep-R-Penn 1995-2007), born in Winchester, Virginia

May 10 Yu Suzuki, Japanese creator of Virtua Fighter series

Peter Antonie, Australian rower (Olympic gold 1992), born in Melbourne, Victoria

Andreas Petroulakis, Greek political caricaturist

May 12 Beth Maitland, American actress (Traci-Young & Restless), born in Rapid City, South Dakota

May 12 Christian Brando, son of Marlon who killed his sisters boyfriend, born in Los Angeles, California (d. 2008)

May 12 Dries Van Noten, Belgian fashion designer (Dries Van Noten), born in Antwerp, Belgium

May 12 Eric Singer [Mensinger], American hard rock drummer (KISS, 1991-present), born in Cleveland, Ohio

May 12 Kim Greist, American actress (CHUD, Brazil, Payoff, Manhunter), born in Stamford, Connecticut

Frances Barber, English actress (Castaway), born in Wolverhampton, England

Christine Brennan, American sports columnist

May 14 Rudy Pérez, Cuban-born American pop and Latin record producer, songwriter, and musician, born in Pinar del Río, Cuba

Ron Simmons, American professional wrestler

Glenn Gregory, English rock vocalist (Heaven 17), born in Sheffield, England

Vincent Henar, Suriname bassist (Fra Fra Sound), born in Paramaribo, Suriname

Ray Donaldson, NFL center (Dallas Cowboys), born in Rome, Georgia

May 18 Toyah Wilcox, English singer ("I Want to Be Free"), actress, and Mrs. Robert Fripp, born in Birmingham, England

Jane Wiedlin, American pop-rock singer, guitarist, and songwriter (The Go-Gos - "Vacation"; "We Got The Beat"; solo - Fur), born in Oconomowoc, Wisconsin

May 20 Mike Stefanik, American auto racer (9 NASCAR Modified Championships), born in Wilbraham, Massachusetts (d. 2019)

May 20 Ron Reagan, American radio host (The Ron Reagan Show) and son of Ronald and Nancy Reagan, born in Los Angeles, California

Sabine Bischoff, German fencer (Olympic gold 1984), born in Tauberbischofsheim, Germany (d. 2013)

Drew Carey

American actor and comedian (Drew Carey Show), born in Cleveland, Ohio

May 23 François Feldman, French pop singer and songwriter (Petit Frank), born in Paris, France

May 23 Mitch Albom, American writer

May 23 Shelly West, American country singer ("Red Hot"; "West by West"), born in Cleveland, Ohio

May 23 Thomas Reiter, German cosmonaut (Soyuz TM-22)

Dorothy Straight, American 4-year-old author (How the World Began), born in Washington, D.C.

May 25 Paul Weller, English guitarist (Jam - "This is Modern World"; Style Council), born in Woking, Surrey, England

Margaret Colin, American actress (Independence Day, Three Men & a Baby), born in Brooklyn, New York

Linnea Quigley, Davenport Iowa, actress (Night of Demons, Virgin High)

May 27 Neil Finn, New Zealand musician (Split Enz; Crowded House - "Don't Dream It's Over"), born in Te Awamutu, New Zealand

Annette Bening

American actress (Grifters, Bugsy, American Beauty), born in Topeka, Kansas

May 29 Ivar Sisniega, Mexican pentathlete, politician (Sports Minister 1994-2000), born in Kenosha, Wisconsin, USA

May 29 Uwe Rapolder, German soccer midfielder, coach (1. FC Köln), born in Hausen an der Zaber, Germany

May 29 Willem Holleeder, Dutch criminal, kidnapper (Freddy Heineken), and murderer, born in Amsterdam, Netherlands

Marie Fredriksson, Swedish pop singer (Roxette - "Must Have Been Love"), born in Össjö, Sweden (d. 2019)

May 30 Michael E Lopez-Alegria, Lt Cmdr/astro (STS 73, sk 92), born in Madrid, Spain

May 30 Steve Israel, American politician, member of the United States House of Representatives (D-New York)

May 30 Ted McGinley, actor (Love Boat, MWC, Dynasty), born in Newport Beach, California

Gary Hallberg, American golfer (3 PGA Tour titles), born in Berwyn, Illinois

May 31 Kyle Secor, American actor (Tim Bayliss-Homicide), born in Tacoma, Washington

May 31 Mkhuseli Jack, South African UDF-leader (consumer boycots)

Famous Weddings

"The Mark of Zorro" actor Tyrone Power (44) weds Debbie Ann Minardos

Famous Deaths

Alfred Weber, German economist and sociologist, dies at 89

Frank Foster, English cricket all-rounder (11 Tests, 3 x 50, 45 wickets, BB 6/91; Warwickshire CCC), dies at 69

James Branch Cabell, American novelist and essayist (Restless Heads), dies at 79

Nyogen Senzaki, 1st Zen teacher to reside in USA, dies at 81

Nasni Matni, Lebanese journalist, assassinated at 48 or 49

May 8 Norman Bel Geddes, American theatrical designer (Rivals, Dead End), dies at 65

Bill Goodwin, American television announcer (Jolson Story, Burns & Allen), dies at 47

Michael G the Boer, historian (Harbor of Amsterdam), dies at 91

Jeroom Verten [Jozef Frans Vermetten], Flemish playwright, dies at 49

Archie Scott-Brown, English race car driver (b. 1927)

May 19 Bruno Stürmer, German conductor, composer and educator dies at 65

Ronald Colman

British actor (Lost Horizon, The Prisoner of Zenda, Phantom Shot), dies at 67

Julien de Valckenaere, Belgian poet, dies at 60

Rolland Beaumont, South African cricket batsman (5 Tests; Transvaal), dies at 74

Ainslie Pryor, American actor (Adventures of Hiram Holiday), dies of cancer at 37

May 27 Samuel Stritch, US cardinal/archbishop (Chicago), dies

Mikuláš Schneider-Trnavský, Slovak composer (Missa pastoralis), dies at 77

Juan Ramon Jiménez, Spanish poet (Distant Gardeens; Nobel Prize for Literature, 1956), dies at 76 [1]

Jozef van Mierlo, Belgian Jesuit and literary (Hadewych), dies at 79
